oai_dc:dc.dc:title: West Knoxville Post Office and White Store, ca. 1952
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: unknown
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: White Store interior on Kingston Pike near Mann's Mortuary (in 2009 the location of Regions Bank), in the Bearden area. The store also served as the West Knoxville Post Office. The woman in the photograph is Imogene Myers and the young man is the grocery store manager (name unknown). The picture was taken to celebrate the addition of the new Royal Crown Cola cooler, ca. 1952. Bearden History Project.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Grocery stores; Carbonated beverages; Portraits;
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: To use photographs or to order reproductions, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8808. Please refer to Image Number if available and provide a brief description of the photograph.
